data.title: Show me the rarest/most obscure games in your physical games collection
data.meta_description:
Pics or didn't happen. Obvs physical because what even is digital rarity?

I'll start.

from left
Monster Madness: Grave Danger - PS3
Fragile Dreams...
data.text:
Sep 26, 2020

#1

Pics or didn't happen. Obvs physical because what even is digital rarity?

I'll start.

from left

Monster Madness: Grave Danger - PS3

Fragile Dreams: Farewell Ruins of the Moon - Wii

Little Red Riding Hood's Zombie BBQ - DS

My World, My Way - DS

Your turn.

I don't really know. I grabbed these kind of at random because I know they go for way too much these days, which probably means rare. I dunno about obscure, though.

I was not going to include Paper Mario, but it's slowly getting there, I think. I guess most Nintendo games stuck on the GameCube are going to fit that bill with time, eh?

#12

My games are almost all in storage so it didn't happen. Prob my rarest might be:

Elminage Original (PSP, Europe, 300 made)

Psychic Killer Taromaru (Saturn, Japan, low print run)

Panzer Dragoon Saga (Saturn, UK, low print run)

I have games that have become more expensive but so much of that on ebay is just scumbags inflating the market, whereas the above I believe are all genuinely hard to find many copies of.

Most obscure are old late 80s/early 90s shareware floppies I wouldn't even know the name of lol

Last edited: Sep 26, 2020

#14

Shared this in a few threads but fun to share again.

JP Institute Tour: Dinosaur Rescue is a collection of Jurassic Park Game 'n Watch style mini games for the Gameboy Advance. It was developed for and released exclusively at a Japanese edutainment park called Jurassic Park Institute Tour which is (obviously) long shut down. Its basically merch for a theme park.

Picked it up in a little game store in Shimokitazawa in 2015. It's cool!

I've pretty much sold every rare game I've had unless I had strong affection. But things like Marvel Vs Capcom 2 on Xbox or MGS Twin Snakes? Naw, sold those.

I don't really own very rare games. I just realized that I actually Thousand Year Door complete a couple weeks ago lol. I'm pretty sure I've never even played it.

Other than that? I have a complete copy of Outrun 2006: Coast 2 Coast for Xbox, and that seems to be getting up there in price. I have every Resident Evil game released on Gamecube (just standard releases), and Code Veronica X is getting up there at over 100 clams according to pricecharting.

I'll take pictures in a bit if it's that important. I just got comfy, lol.

#37

Not everything here is rare, but this is a complete-ish collection of PC RPG->NES ports that I built over the past year and a half. Ultima 3, 4, and Wizardry are common enough, but Wizardry 2, Bard's Tale, and Pool of Radiance are all a little harder to find, Times of Lore and Might & Magic are pricey and rare, and Ultima 5 (the worst game in the bunch) is downright expensive and rare.

Random things, and I can go get pics I guess:

Numbered Okie Dokie cartridge for Atari 2600, bought at release. (I'm on this list: http://www.atarihq.com/2678/okielist.html Note that #1 is now VP Dev Rel at NVIDIA.)

Castlevania Chronicles for PS1

The House of the Dead (US release) for Sega Saturn

I'm sure I've got others - been collecting things since 1995.

Edit: Wow. People asking $700+ for Okie Dokie cartridge on eBay? Wowzers.
